name: Safari 16.4
available: macOS Big Sur and macOS Monterey

advisories.available: macOS Big Sur and macOS Monterey
advisories.impact: Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited against versions of iOS released before iOS 15.7.
advisories.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved state management.

cves.credit: Georgy Kucherin (@kucher1n), Leonid Bezvershenko (@bzvr_), and Boris Larin (@oct0xor) of Kaspersky

advisories.available: macOS Big Sur and macOS Monterey
advisories.impact: Processing maliciously crafted web content may bypass Same Origin Policy
advisories.description: This issue was addressed with improved state management.

advisories.available: macOS Big Sur and macOS Monterey
advisories.impact: A website may be able to track sensitive user information
advisories.description: The issue was addressed by removing origin information.

advisories.available: macOS Big Sur and macOS Monterey
advisories.impact: Processing a file may lead to a denial-of-service or potentially disclose memory contents
advisories.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks.

advisories.available: macOS Big Sur and macOS Monterey
advisories.impact: Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution
advisories.description: A use-after-free issue was addressed with improved memory management.

cves.credit: hazbinhotel working with Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative

advisories.available: macOS Big Sur and macOS Monterey
advisories.impact: Content Security Policy to block domains with wildcards may fail
advisories.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved validation.

cves.credit: Gertjan Franken of imec-DistriNet, KU Leuven

advisories.available: macOS Big Sur and macOS Monterey
advisories.impact: A remote attacker may be able to cause unexpected app termination or arbitrary code execution
advisories.description: This issue was addressed with improved state management.

cves.credit: Dohyun Lee (@l33d0hyun), crixer (@pwning_me) of SSD Labs
